title: [BSCOMP0013] netBloc Vol. 13 color in a world of monochrome
description:
This is a back to basics release that presents all 10 tracks in the regular netBloc format. However, this release also features publicly available photography from the Library of CongressÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ extensive catalog. Not in the public domain, but available for non-commercial use is the ground-breaking photography of Sergei Prokudin-Gorskii. In 1905 he was the first person to develop a way to take color photos. He used a rapid succession of three monochromatic photos, each through a different color filter Ã¢â‚¬â€ red, green and blue Ã¢â‚¬â€ to achieve his goal. In the PDF I link to a great wikipedia article about him and his technique. YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll also find a link to the Library of CongressÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Prokudin-Gorskii gallery. That is definitely worth a look.


This audio is part of the collection: blocSonic
It also belongs to collection: Netlabels

Artist/Composer: Michael Gregoire
Date: 2008-02-24
Keywords: rock; electronic; pop; indie; hip-hop; electropop
